8 bit.gadget: Cheat Cartridge overall. Use Extra Credits in Heist.
8 bit.starpower: Boosted Booster overall. Plugged In for sniper/counter matchups and Gem Grab.
8 bit.gear: Reload Speed and Health. Replace Health with Vision (grassy map) or Damage (Heist) when necessary.

amber.gadget: Dancing Flames. Fire Starters if sniper matchup.

angelo.gadget: Stinging Flight for ladder. Master Fletcher used more by pros.
angelo.starpower: Empower. Flow not bad for watery maps.

barley.gadget: Sticky Syrup in ladder and for agro. Herbal Tonic good in ranked.
barley.starpower: Personal preference. Medical Use against throwers, Extra Noxious against tanks.

bea.gadget: Rattled Hive. Honey Molasses if against snipers.
bea.starpower: Insta Beaload for casuals. Pros use Honeycomb to move up map.

belle.gadget: Nest Egg. Reverse Polarity has some uses in certain maps.
belle.starpower: Positive Feedback. Grounded underrated in ranked against agro.

berry.gadget: Friendship is Great. Healthy Additives in Heist (does 20% of safe).
berry.tips: Attack is impact + damage zone after. Damage zone doesn't stack. Weak vs tanks

bibi.starpower: Home Run 99% of time. Batting Stance sometimes on grassy maps + vs tanks.

bo.gadget: Both gadgets lackluster. Tripwire opens up map on command but Super Totem can tank shots.
bo.starpower: Snare a Bear. Circling Eagle for weird bush maps (Snake Prairie and Cavern Churn).

brock.gadget: Rocket Fuel 99% of time. Rocket Laces okay in ladder for unknown enemies.
brock.starpower: More Rockets! Rocket No. 4 can be good in Knockout or Bounty but hard to fully utilize.

bull.gadget: Stomper. T-Bone Injector can be used for Heist base races.
bull.starpower: Tough Guy. Berserker hard to get value out of.

buzz.gadget: Reserve Buoy. X-Ray-Shades is very good on grassy maps.
buzz.starpower: Eyes Sharp. Tougher Torpedo for tanks.

byron.gadget: Booster Shots is good for cycling super. Shot in the Arm is okay against snipers.
byron.starpower: Malaise messes up enemy healing. Injection if you're healing behind a tank.

carl.gadget: Heat Ejector for Heist/Spirit Wars. Flying Hook in Bounty or for more skilled players.
carl.gear: Damage and Health. Carl is flexible so mix and match with Shield and Gadget Charge as well.

charlie.gadget: Spiders unless enemy has piercing attacks, then use Personal Space.
charlie.starpower: Both are lackluster. Spen uses Slimy since it provides value if you miss super. Digestive also okay vs tanks.

chester.gadget: Spicy Dice better for getting good supers. Candy Beans can work for bad matchups.
chester.gear: Damage and Gadget Charge. Chester is versatile so you can mix and match with Health and Shield, or use Speed and Vision in grassy maps.

chuck.gadget: Rerouting in Heist. Ghost Train for Hot Zone or Knockout.
chuck.starpower: Pit Stop. It and Tickets Please! are decent.

clancy.gadget: Snappy Shooting. Pros have been starting to use Tactical Retreat to get closer.
clancy.gear: Speed and Vision for grassy maps. Otherwise use Damage and Shield.
clancy.tips: Stage one sucks and requires getting out of asap.

collette.starpower: Mass Tax for Heist, otherwise use Push It.

colt.gadget: Speedloader. Silver bullet good for opening up map.
colt.starpower: Slick Boots. Magnum Special can still be good.

cordelius.gadget: Replanting. Poison Mushroom for bushy maps or Showdown.
cordelius.starpower: Depends on your playstyle if Comboshrooms or Mushroom Kingdom is better.

crow.starpower: Carrion Crow since he's only good in Heist.

darryl.gadget: Tar Barrel. Recoiling Rotator in Heist or to charge super.

draco.tips: Pairs great with Kit, Byron when supering. Great for when pressure is needed (hot zone, etc.)

edgar.gadget: Let's Fly. Hardcore in passive game modes like Duels.
edgar.starpower: Hard landing vs squishy. Fisticuffs for super cycling.

el primo.starpower: Meteor Rush, but it can be personal preference if you use El Fuego to finish off opponents.

fang.starpower: Divine Soles. Fresh Kicks better against bad players.

frank.gadget: Active Noise Canceling. Irresistible Attraction still good though.
frank.starpower: Power Grab. Sponge for very bad matchups.

gale.gadget: Twister. Spring Ejector good for certain maps (Kaboom Canyon).
gale.starpower: Freezing Snow. Blustery Blow to counter tanks better in maps with a lot of walls.
gale.gear: Speed and Vision for grassy maps. Otherwise use Damage and Shield.
gale.hypercharge: Hypercharge is the best one in the game.

gene.gadget: Vengeful Spirits in open maps. Lamp Blowout for cancelling supers in Brawl Ball or Gem Grab.
gene.starpower: Magic Puffs is one of the best star powers in the game. Spirit Slap against tanks.
gene.gear: Talk to the Hand and Vision. Swap out Talk to the Hand for Speed in very bushy map or Vision for Shield in grassless maps.

gray.starpower: Fake Injury on Knockout/Bounty or against sharpshooters. New Perspective elsewhere.
gray.gear: Damage and Gadget Charge. Shield instead of Damage if running Fake Injury.

griff.tips: Midrange wallbreaker. Use on any map you need a wallbreak + midrange on

grom.gadget: Radio Check. Watchtower is good for tanking or on grassy maps.

jacky.gadget: Pneumatic Booster. Don't let TikTok convince you Rebuild is good.

janet.gear: Speed and Vision for grassy maps. Otherwise Damage and Shield.

jessie.gadget: Spark Plug. Recoil Spring in Heist
jessie.gear: Damage and Pet Power in Heist. Damage and Shield/Speed/Vision anywhere else.

juju.gadget: Both good. Voodoo Chile easier to use but Elementalist can make good plays.

kenji.tips: Can dash into wall and then use swipe to wall peek for more dmg/range

kit.gadget: Cardboard Box. Cheeseburger in cheese comp.
kit.starpower: Overly Attached in 3v3. Power Hungry in Showdown.

leon.starpower: Invisiheal. Smoke Trails for an open map.

lola.starpower: Sealed with a Kiss if you like ego behind you. Improvise against healers or tanks.

mandy.gadget: Cookie Crumbs. Caramelize for unoptimal modes or to combo with super.

max.starpower: Run N Gun. Super Charged if passive team composition.
max.gear: Shield and Health or Gadget Charge and Damage.

mico.starpower: Monkey business. Record Smash in Heist or Showdown.

moe.gadget: Dodgy Digging. Rat Race can make good plays.
moe.starpower: Skipping Stones for tanks. Speeding Ticket for Bounty/Knockout to move up and extend your range.

nani.gadget: Return to Sender in Bounty/Knockout or against other snipers. Warpin' Time in Heist/Brawl Ball/Gem Grab.
nani.starpower: Autofocus in Bounty/Knockout. Tempered Steel in other gamemodes.

nita.gadget: Bear Paws. Faux Fur is easier to use.
nita.starpower: Hyper Bear. Bear With Me works well with Hyperbearing (hypercharge)

otis.gear: Speed and Vision for grassy maps. Otherwise use Damage and Shield/Super Charge.
otis.hypercharge: Hypercharge is worth it once it gets fixed.

pam.gear: Super Turret and Health (open map)/Vision (grassy map)/Gadget Charge (into agro).

pearl.gear: Damage and Health/Vision/Shield. In grassy maps use Speed and Vision.

penny.starpower: Heavy Coffers. Run Master Blaster in ladder or Brawl Ball.
penny.gear: Damage and Shield. In grassy maps use Speed and Vision.

piper.gadget: Auto Aimer in Gem Grab. Homemade Recipe in Knockout/Bounty.
piper.gear: Shield and Gadget Charge. Occasionally swap out gadget charge for Vision/Health.

poco.gadget: Tuning Fork. Protective Tunes can work in ranked.
poco.starpower: Screeching Solo. Da Capo! has good synergy with other brawlers.

r t.gadget: Out of Line. Hacks! if long range matchup.
r t.starpower: Recording. If you never have to split use Quick Maths.
r t.gear: Health and Shield. Damage gear is a bit bugged.

rico.gadget: Multiball Launcher. Bouncy Castle for really bad matchups.
rico.starpower: Super Bouncy. Robo Retreat better if bad matchup (wall breakers, throwers, assassins).

ruffs.gadget: Air Support. Take Cover against snipers.
ruffs.gear: Damage and Shield. In grassy maps use Vision and Speed.

sandy.tips: Try to use super in a way that enables you to charge your super back. (Generally avoid using unless you have full hp and can push up with team).

shade.gadget: Long arms better gadget by far.
shade.starpower: Hardened hoodies is really good. Other one is okay but shield is much better.
shade.tips:
Heavily enabled by walls. Great in brawl ball, gem grab, and hot zone.
Matchup list according to spen: https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/931255199627112458/1314104641247514624/The_Only_Shade_Guide_Youll_Ever_Need_4-11_screenshot.png?ex=67528ed1&is=67513d51&hm=50f1dee469c3079dcde589f9abda83b33c46a33bfd4f2dceffb288ba4fa597f4&

shelly.starpower: Shell Shock. Band-Aid can be good on Showdown, Knockout, and Bounty.

spike.gadget: Life Plant. Popping Pincushion on heist

squeak.starpower: Personal preference. Pros prefer Super Sticky but Chain Reaction can still provide value.

stu.gadget: Breakthrough. Speedzone for Hot Zone/Gem Grab.

surge.gadget: Power Shield. Power Surge if against pros since hard to charge super.
surge.gear: Damage and Speed/Shield. In very grassy maps replace Damage for Vision.

tara.gadget: Support From Beyond. Psychic Enhancer against pierce or Snake Prairie.
tara.starpower: Healing Shade. Black Portal not bad against snipers.

tick.gadget: Last Hurrah. Mine Mania underrated in maps with lots of chokepoints.
tick.starpower: Well Oiled. Automa-Tick Reload if no enemy throwers/threats

willow.starpower: Obsession. Love is blind is bugged

meeple.gadget: Ragequit is slightly better but both gadgets are insane.
meeple.tips: Best matchups are vs midhp brawlers (~6k range). Always preserve ammo to win engagement due to slow reload. Use super offensively on enemy walls.
